result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 1 year - costs $443.00 - restitution of $2120 jt/Several payable to Elaine Smith and undergo any treatment DOC may impose.

miscConds.notes: Restitution joint/several $2120.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Costs $243.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To undergo any treatment that DOC may impose.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: 9 months county jail credit for good time and 202 days time served DE to be released today.
Costs as previously ordered are converted to civil judgment

judgments.dispoDesc: Probation is revoked and sentence is imposed

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in court with attorney Joseph M. Schieffer.  Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has SEHR 15 CM 294. 
 State recites agreement:  15 CM 294:  9 months county jail credit for good time and 202 days time served - court obligations if not paid converted to civil judgment     16 CM 462:  plead to count 1 - 6 months county jail impose/stay - Imposed probation 2 years - costs - if revoked from probation jail is concurrent to each other  count 2 DRI  Count 3 - 30 days county jail impose/stayed - probation Imposed 2 years - costs - if revoked from probation jail is concurrent to each other
DE entered plea of guilty to counts 1 and 3 in 16 CM 462.      DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court finds defendant guilty counts 1 and 3 and count 2 is dismissed and read-in.

COURT:  15 CM 294:  9 months county jail credit for good time and 202 days time served to be released today - court obligations if not paid are converted to civil judgment.

16 CM 462: Count 1 - 6 months county jail imposed/stayed - Probation 2 years - costs -  any counseling DOC may impose and count 2 is dismissed and read-in - if probation is revoked jail is to run consecutive to 12 CF 165.

Count 3:  30 days county jail imposed/stayed - probation 2 years - costs - any counseling DOC may recommend - if revoked from probation jail is concurrent to count 1 and consecutive to 12 CF 165.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.

SCHEDULING/STATUS CONFERENCE HELD WITH JUDICIAL ASSISTANT (OFF THE RECORD). Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer in court, defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier not in court, in custody.    Parties have an agreement - ask for plea date.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for March 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling conference on February 14, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in court with attorney Vincent Scott Kurta.  Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in custody.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:23 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances. State -plead sentence w/held probation 1 year - rest. $2120.00 jt/several Elaine Smith and costs plus DNA Surcharge.  Atty Kurta agrees as does the defendant.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Atty stipulates to a factual basis.  State argues sentenceing (co-defendant Mr. Blank). Victim stmt tendered to the court.   Atty Kurta argues sentencing.  Defendant addressed the Court.  

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 1 year - Costs including DNAAS $443.00 - restitution of $2120.00 jt/several payable to Elaine Smith - undergo any treatment DOC may impose

Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in court via video with attorney Vincent Scott Kurta.  Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant entered NG plea by Atty Kurta.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
